name: Sea Bass Veracruz
author: Genevieve Johns Seivert
summary: A delicious, light dish with yummy Mexican flavors. A great change to grilled or roasted fish. Mexican rice is a great side for this.
ingredients: 2 cups Roma tomatoes, seeded and diced
¼ cup jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine tomatoes, olives, cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, and capers together in a bowl
Place flour in a shallow bowl
Place fish on a flat work surface and season with salt and pepper
Dredge one side of each fillet in flour
Heat oil in a large, ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat
Add fish, flour-side down, and saute for 3 minutes
Stir broth into skillet and scrape the bottom to deglaze
Add onion, garlic, bay leaves, and thyme
Place skillet in the preheated oven and roast until fish flakes easily with a fork, 5 to 7 minutes
Add remaining tomato mixture to the skillet
Serve fillets topped with tomato mixture
